text:
時折思い出しては見に来たくなります。
2020東京オリンピックは、日本では裏金問題や数々の炎上問題などがあり、必ずしも順風満帆な大会ではありませんでした。
ですが、開催に際して公開されたこちらの映像作品にはじまり、一生懸命精進する選手さんの方々にはとてもワクワクさせていただきました。
こちらの東京をモチーフとした爽快な歌謡、映像をはじめてみた時の感動は、今なお色褪せることがありません。

text:
東京オリンピックの開会式と閉会式が終わった一年後（2022年）にたまたま検索でヒットしてこの動画を見た日本人ですが、このBBCの予告動画やフランスのテレビ局のCMやリオオリンピックの閉会式の時のフラッグシップセレモニーの方がよっぽど日本らしいと感じました。

Translate to English by DeepL↓
I am a Japanese who happened to hit upon this video in a search a year after the Tokyo Olympics opening and closing ceremonies (2022), but I felt that this BBC preview video, French TV commercials, and the flagship ceremony during the Rio Olympics closing ceremony were much more Japan-like.

text: 日本の人々は冗談を言う：中国と韓国は第二次世界大戦で日本を憎み、アニメは日本のプロパガンダだと思っている そのため、中国共産党は、2020 年の世界的大流行で東京の壮大なオリンピック アニメ パーティーを爆破することを決定しましたが、韓国が平昌で kpop と BTS を宣伝する機会を惜しみませんでした。 でも、パンデミックの後、東京オリンピックにもう一度挑戦してみませんか

text: Umm... I'm a Japanese, and really embarrassed to imagine a strange view for Tokyo from overseas. First, the scene of a street full of shops beside and crowded people reminds me of a street in OSAKA, not in TOKYO. Second, recently, there have not been the game-playing people in a small shop inside; the corona pandemic has already driven away those people, and such game shops run by companies, like SEGA, have been closed Third, in the latter half of this movie, there is a city view of many blue lights in night. Of course, even at midnight, some districts, like Shimjuku, are light and crowded. But, to tell the truth, there is not anywhere full of only one color.

text: 🌏自然とともにひとり一人の命をつなぐ本当の意味での東日本大震災を真剣に考えないと明日の日本は無い。復興五輪をやっている暇は無い。福島原発事故は今も解決していない。原発維持を言っていた安倍前首相の時に真剣に反原発を考えて行ったら生活不安や健康被害を考えるチャンスに成った。安倍前首相の判断の積み重ねからミスや過ちを犯し、外国で起きた原発事故を考えていれば廃炉や新エネルギーがもっと前に進んでいた。今も尚、生活不安や健康被害をもたらす日本の原発は原発が出来た時に問題課題が有っただから教訓から学ばない原発維持の安倍前首相の判断の積み重ねからミスや過ちをもたらした。🌏自然と向き合いひとり一人の命を守りひとり一人と寄り添って生きる力が反原発や廃炉や新エネルギーを考える日本人です。🌎🌍🌏脱原発とともにほんものの自然の力が心を強くする生きる力🌏🌍🌎過去を顧みてこそ未来がある日本社会🗾🌏ほんものの自然を残す事が嘘偽りのない自然の力が生きる力です。🌏ほんものとは、自然を壊さず地球を汚さないでつくったもの。自分の良心に訴えて恥ずかしくないもの。人をだまさんもののことである。自然は私達ひとり一人を見ています。私達ひとり一人の生命も自然です。🌏
author: @自然の力と共にいまを生きる嘘

text: 🌍国会を蔑ろに国会答弁も出来ない政治介入の自民党菅政治を問い正す事が命と暮らしを守るほんものの政治です。🌍パンデミックの負の五輪の政治利用する東京オリンピックを問い直す事が命と暮らしを守る日本人です🌍政治利用や平和利用する政治家はスポーツを語る資格なし🌍政治利用しない事がほんもののスポーツです。🌍パンデミックの世界中に混乱を招く東京オリンピックを問い直す事がほんもののオリンピック精神です🌍
author: @自然の力と共にいまを生きる嘘

text: 🌏生まれ変わる世界とともにひとり一人の生命を守る事が求められる国際社会🌎手を差し伸べる現場ひとり一人の声を聞く耳を澄ませることが思いやる想像力と知恵を使って、支え合う豊かなコミュニティを国のすみずみに作っていくゆくことが、ひとり一人に寄り添っていく命と暮らしを守るこれからの社会だと思います。そんな大人たちの姿はきっと、子供たちの胸に未来への希望を灯すでしょう。🌏大変なコロナ禍だからこそわれわれ市民が常に心にとどめておかないといけないのは、決して忘れないということ。そして黙らないということだ。それ以外に社会人としての使命は果たせない。🌏生まれ変わる世界とともに忘れない黙らない現場ひとり一人の発信力と共に誰もが誰かに助けられて生きていていることに気づかせる共同体の存在を現場ひとり一人の精神を世界中に広げてゆく。どうか皆さん現場ひとり一人の歓声とともに一緒に頑張りましょう🌍大変なコロナ禍だからこそ現場ひとり一人の声を知る力が求められる国際社会🌏

text: honestly this trailer alone with the Rio 2016 closing ceremony handover presentation was better than both the Tokyo 2020 opening and closing ceremonies combined. given the context of the pandemic and it’s restrictions, i understand that it would be hard to do a grander, much richer performance. but it’s just really sad to see its organizing team be plagued with so much internal conflict and so many resignations. if they really hired talented, unproblematic creatives to run the ceremonies’ performances, i’m sure it would be packed with Japan’s rich history and tradition alongside their modern pop culture, all while being respectful to the situation of the pandemic.

text: 🌍哲学の無い自民党菅政治とともに組織委員の不祥事が問題視する中で誰も責任を取らない無責任な組織委員はスポーツを語る資格なし。そういう環境ではアスリートは育たない。開催しても国民ひとり一人の命と暮らしには直結しない。世界中で起きている感染拡大や地球温暖化に取り組む事が、世界中の人々は関心が高いです。🌍人流や感染対策を徹底して来なかった現場主義者ではない小池都知事と自民党菅政治を問いただす事が求められる日本人です。🌍中国共産党習近平を問いただす事が求められる🌍国民ひとり一人の命と暮らしを守る為にも医療現場がひっ迫しない為にもひとり一人の思いやりの行動が問われます。🌍原稿でしか対応出来ない本音を語れない哲学の無い自民党菅首相は具体的な強いメッセージが問われる。感染リスクの下げ止まりも鈍い状況が続いているのも事実です。国民ひとり一人の命と暮らしを守れない自民党菅首相の矛盾した行動が医療爆発を起こし国民ひとり一人の命を奪う現実が悪化を招く自民党菅政治を問い正す事が求められる🌎デルタ株と戦っている医療現場も自宅療養の方々を忘れない為にも初めてだからこそ今こそロックダウンをする事が核兵器無き世界とともにつなぐつながる助かる命が助かる思いやりの日本人です🌏大変な変異ウィルスだからこそ核兵器無き世界とともに人びとの命を守る事が内閣総理大臣の使命です。🌏世界中の人びととともに人権問題や人道支援を語るには哲学がなければ語れない。パンデミックの東京オリンピックから見えて来た現実社会問題です🌏

text:
The Olympics must not exhibit any political or biased tendencies.  The host country, Japan, is also disseminating this information to athletes and officials who participated in the Olympics.  
But Japan, meanwhile, asked the IOC to require that athletes who participated in the Olympics pay a silent tribute to the victims on the day the atomic bomb was dropped on Hiroshima.  
The dropping of the atomic bomb on Hiroshima was not an easy decision made by the United States, the Allied Powers at the time, in that Japan, a war criminal country, did not give up on the war and continued to kill innocent people.  
Remembrance of the victims of the atomic bombing is no different from forcing people to visit Japanese shrines.  
This double aspect of Japan does not qualify as a host country for the Olympics, a place of global harmony, and even after the IOC rejected Japan's request to commemorate the atomic bombing, the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Committee said they plans to include a performance that  commemorate the victims of the atomic bombing in this Olympic closing ceremony. This proves that Japan has not yet abandoned its role as a war criminal country rather than an Olympic host country.  
I hope that the people of the world will face this double aspect of Japan and correct their misconceptions about Japan. I also demand the IOC not to tolerate this double act of Japan, the host country of the Olympics, and take corresponding measures.
author: @mst0452

text:
평창 트레일러와 비교했을 때 일본과 한국이 얼마나 다른지 알 수 있는 영상
한국은 국가, 언어, 문화의 구분없이 바로 이해할 수 있는 마스코트의 귀여움을 앞세우면서 무난하게 올림픽 종목들을 소개하는데 (마치 한국에서 영어와 세계화를 아주 중시하는 것처럼. 때로는 우리 문화가 뒷전인 경우가 있는 것처럼)
일본은 그들 자신의 문화를 앞세움 일뽕 맞은 서양인들을 정확히 자극하고 있음 당연함 도쿄 올림픽은 동일본 대지진 이후에 무너진 일본을 다시 재건하고 부흥하려는 의도가 가득 담긴 올림픽이기 때문에
누가 낫다 뭐다 할 게 아니라 다른 점이 너무 확연히 보여서 신기하다

text:
무한극락은 발전이 끝이 있고--고통의 종말-- 무한극락발전은 끝이 없다--

무상정등각--
변화 인연 생성 모순 긍정무한 무한와중 무한와중발전 무한극락 무한극락발전--

마음은 무한자기다--

무한은 모든 것들을 품어준다--무한은 현재와 순간에서 모든 것이(비논리 역설 모순 횡설수설 등이) 가능하다--

연결주의-연기론이 존재론을 품어준다--연결와중-연결와중발전--연결극락--연결극락발전--

니체의 영혼--현실에 안주하지 말고 위험하게도 살 수 있어야 된다--

이승세계와 사바세계는 분별이 없다--자타일여--
사바세계가 무한이다--

연결주의-인연연결이 존재론과 정신분석과 현대철학 모두를 품는다--
억지생각은 방하해야 된다--

중도 연결 융합--

상호의존해서 화합한다--

무한극락--영원한 자유--

무한과 부처님--무한이 부처다--
무한은 모든 종교를 품어준다--
불교의 자비는 상호의존 융합 화합이고, 자비는 모든 것을 가능케 해준다--

무한은 엄마다--

불생불멸이 끝이 없는 무한이다--

무한은 자비다--
무한은 모든 장애를 해결해준다--
불교의 자비는 무한이라는 다른 이름이다--
무한이 현전과 순간을 품어준다--
모든 근거가 무한이다--

무한이 모든 유한을 품어준다--

생멸인연이 무한에서 온다--
무한이 모든 유한을 가능케 한다--
무한으로 말미암아 모든 것을 성립시킨다--
무한이 유한을 품는다--

무한이 모든 것을 품는다--
무한-자비가 공과 무상 무아 연기 중도를 품는다--
모든 것이 무한에서 온다--
author: @반야바라밀-e1k

Elaine Thompson-Herah, Shelly-Ann Fraser-Pryce and Shericka Jackson, such a strong line up, kept up the great work after the booming start by Williams.

A great race.  
Godspeed!

text:
パリ五輪関連記事で「東京五輪のピクトグラムは誰も傷つけない素晴らしいパフォーマンスだった」的なことを言われていて久しぶりに見たくなった。

やっぱり、見れば見るほど小林賢太郎のパフォーマンスのセンスだし、これが東京五輪の開会式の中でも高い評価を得てるのが彼のファンとしては嬉しい。
特に、 2:31 からの手を使ったパフォーマンスは本当に小林賢太郎のパフォーマンスで見たかったと感じてしまう。

その一方で、「誰も傷つけない」って言われるようなパフォーマンスを作った人が、過去のネタの件で降ろされたのが残念でならない。名前は出さないのに、演出プランだけ盗むんだ、へぇ。という気持ちになる。
author: @Maxako

text:
Pictogramas q apareceram no livro
Tóquio 1964: Atletismo
Cidade Do México: Pentalo Moderno
Munique 1972: Tiro De Arco
Monteral 1976: Hóquei
Moscou 1980: Polo Aquático
Los Angeles 1984: Natação
Seul 1988: Tênis De Mesa
Barcelona 1992: Tênis

text:
ものすごく小林賢太郎さんみを感じる。わかる人にはわかるだろう。
人を傷つけない笑いを作るに至った方の「今」を評価しないで、「過去」の若さをほじくり返して足を引っ張る。
こういうアイデアだけ盗んで、今頃になってピクトグラムのとこは良かった、とか言う。
彼をはじめ、素晴らしい才能あるクリエーターをことごとく嫌な目に遭わせたのが悲しい。
それでも今、改めてこのピクトグラムの演出が賞賛されるなら、慰めになるのかな。
私はずっと彼の作品のファンです。

text:
パリ五輪が物議をかもした関係でこの動画を見つけました。
視聴が初めての人間にも、「64年から二度目の東京開催」「歴代五輪開催国の中での日本らしさ」が一目で理解できる素晴らしいオープニングパフォーマンスだと思います。

それとセーリング(3:25)やボート(4:06)など、華麗さだけでないコメディーチックな面白さも織り込まれているのが笑いを誘って楽しいです。

text:
自分語り失礼します。
2021年、ちょうど小6でした
運動会のときドラクエで入場して、自分たちで創作したピクトグラムやったんです
グループごとにやってたんですが私たちは自撮りとかジョジョ立ちとかそんなことしてました(笑)
コロナが蔓延してみんなで何ができるだろうかなんて考えてた時、スポーツにも何にも興味がなかったあの時の私も東京五輪のオープニングとこのピクトグラムだけは食い入るように見ていたのを覚えています
今でもこうやって見に来てしまいます
大好きです

text:
仏・巴里五輪開会式からこの動画を見に来た方が多いこと。w
東京五輪の開会式で全50競技を3人のパントマイマーがピクトグラム(ピクトグラフ)を演じて、だれもが傷つかないのを証明している。
巴里五輪が想像以上にやらかして、五輪公式(CIO または IOC)が巴里五輪開会式動画を削除したのは、一応「これはやばい」という認識をしているんでしょう。今更遅いのですが、欧米人からすればババに砂かけて無かったことにするのを体現したと思いますがね。w
author: @早地峯カクラ

text: 削除すればいいってものじゃない。確かに「見どころ」はあったパリ五輪の開会式は半永久的に人々の記憶に残る羽目になりました
author: @macha3009

text:
あの世界中から批判を浴びたパリ五輪の開会式を見てからだと、東京五輪のこのピクトグラムを用いたパフォーマンスって素晴らしいなと思ってしまう。
ピクトグラムは誰かが信仰する宗教を傷つけないし、黒人・白人・黄色人種の区別もないし、性別も感じさせず、誰が見ても一目で何を表しているのか分かる。
平和で平等な誰もが使える可愛い図記号。

text:
コロナ禍で地味な開会式だと思ったけどさ…。今見ると…何かバタバタ感があって面白いわ。今回、お腐乱すが毎日やらかしてるお陰で、ポリコレの無い開会式は良かったんだなーと再認識出来たわ。
おかしな方向に目覚めると、団結どころか、不平等と分断しか生まないって証明した様なもんだわ。
UBIがやってる事そのまんまってのが、流石フランスって感じ。アサクリ知らない人に、説明しやすくなったわ。
さて、次はアメリカだけどフランスの失敗を見て、どう出てくるかねー？
楽しみだわー。

text:
厳密に言うと日本発祥ではありません。元のアイディアはすでにありました。
ですが1964年の東京大会でオリンピック種目の表示方法として採用、同時期からトイレのマークなど来日した外国人にも解りやすいサインとして徐々に世界にも普及し、現在まで国内外で広く使われるきっかけとなったのは本当に素晴らしいと思います。
author: @五分五分-g6t

@@五分五分-g6t

text: 五輪大会へと独自に考案したオリジナリティ溢れるピクトグラムを採り入れたのは日本の発祥であり、それは正しく元祖と言えるが、今回の五輪大会の当初のモティーフは”平仮名や鳥獣戯画”、しかし全ての種目への割り当ては不可なため、”最終的には”1964年東京五輪大会ピクトグラムをリスペクトしたプランで進めることにしたとのこと　パラサポ【東京2020】エンブレム＆ピクトグラムのデザイン制作秘話　グラフィックデザイナー廣村氏談

text: Individual vs team effort: Well before year 2000, drafting on the bike section was strictly prohibited. Thanks to this, triathlon was a really hard individual sport. Later ITU introduced drafting to make triathlon more presentable and enjoyable to the viewers. (Questionable decision, but that's OK.) With this decision triathlon partly became a team sport. Those who think this is BS, should try to perform 40K on bike with around 40km/h alone, or in the middle of a group. Drafting helps even mediocre bikers to stay in "business" with no hard effort. That's what I call "team effort" with huge advantage taken. Do happily holding hands in the last few meters qualifies as team sport with no hard effort? With no advantage taken at all? Really?
author: @anymotionvideo7950

text: Was thinking along the same lines. I though absolutely hate that they allowed drafting to be legal, basically negates the power of strong cycling performers. And as for the ITU ruling in this event in particular, pathetic ..

text:
This application of the rules is simply watering down the competition at the Olympics. Instead of watching the best from the UK, now we watch the third best.


Ice hockey has the best guidelines for rules (yeah I am Canadian). In hockey, breaking an on ice rule is not enough to make the referee call a penalty. In addition to a broken rule, there must also be an advantage gained by the offender. I have always felt this was the best way to enforce rules for all sports.


If no advantage gained - no penalty.

3.2. Warning:
a.) The purpose of a warning is to alert an athlete about a possible rule violation and to promote a "proactive" attitude on the part of Technical Officials. Also a Technical Official can determine a warning to an athlete to correct a minor

infringement
b.) A warning may be given when:
(i) An athlete violates a rule unintentionally;
(ii) A Technical Official believes a violation is about to occur;
(iii) No advantage has been gained.
c.) Giving a warning: The Technical Official will blow their whistle, the athlete will be stopped if necessary, asked to modify their behavior, and be allowed to continue the competition immediately afterwards.

A total farce in my opinion... it was a GB 1-2... whichever way around it was... so nothing was really "manipulated" per se....
No WTS points were on offer here and was a "test" event.... anything other and you can bet they would have raced to the line...
The only manipulation here is by the organisers themselves- denying the front 2 a potential oly' spot AND moving everyone else up a couple of places... also manipulating qualification for other countries athletes...!!
Clearly it's ok to carry a team member over the line in a competitive Tri'-  like the WTS final of 2016- but not to be hand in hand at a "test" event...!!!

text:
Reliable data on radiation risks is difficult to obtain, said Jonathan Links, a public health professor at Johns Hopkins University. And, with cosmic rays and other sources emitting natural or “background” ionizing radiation, it can be difficult to pinpoint whether an acceptable threshold for additional, low-level exposure exists at all.

In terms of athletes and coaches visiting the impacted prefectures for a week or two during the Olympics, Links said the cancer risk is proportional, growing incrementally each day.

The Japanese government has raised what it considers to be the acceptable exposure from 1 millisievert to 20 millisieverts per year. Along with this adjustment, officials have declared much of the region suitable for habitation, lifting evacuation orders in numerous municipalities. Housing subsidies that allowed evacuees to live elsewhere have been discontinued.

https://www.latimes.com/sports/olympics/story/2019-08-12/tokyo-olympics-2020-fukushima-nuclear-disaster

text: Was a rule technically broken - yes. Did it disadvantage other athletes- no. Did it show women’s sport in general and triathlon in particular in a good light - yes. Is it a good advert for the sport - yes. Officials should not be there if all they are capable of is saying a rule is a rule. They should be empowered to look at any infringement in context - ie is there unfair advantage? Is there unfair disadvantage? Could it bring sport into disrepute? In this case there was no unfair disadvantage, no unfair advantage and the image portrayed was positive. In the 80’s I took up running and triathlon as cycling had been taken over by blazers who thought it was imperative to tape over branding on cycling shoes. Cycling has changed massively for the better since then. I’m now planning a return to Triathlon and am sad to find the blazers have a foothold here. Awful decision which makes Tri look ridiculous.

Though the rules are pretty clear, the authorities could have used their discretion while implementing them.

Instead, disqualifying them has more major implications than their actions did !!!
Sticking to the rules doesn't mean that it is the right call.

text:
Yes, they should be punished BECAUSE: This is how weak rules get corrected, if enough of this happens at high level events it's guaranteed the rule will be re-written. Maybe the rule could help distinguish the winner easier if they didn't have photo-finish cameras, but clearly they do and defer to them immediately for winner clarification. So then who cares if 2 people finish at the same time, officially you'll always have your winner. 

What other sport with a finish line has a rule about "try hard at the end" judged solely by the officials working that day?? Especially such a physically and mentally demanding one, for you require the athletes to give any more effort than they WANT to put in is frankly ignorant, rude, and contradictory to you changing race lengths for the athlete "safety" (clearly for the organizer's insurance claim safety).

It is a beautiful thing when athletes do this. Good on them!

text:
How as triathletes can we complain about people drafting or Patrick Lange littering 200 meters before the finish line in Kona  - saying people are not upholding the rules - and find it stupid if someone upholds the rules. 
1. Those are all pros earning their living with this sport and they should know the rules as every electirician and tax advisor for their particular job.
2. We should challenge the rules as such in order to make triathlon more attractive as a sport.
Question which we should try to answer to challenge the existing rule : Would anyone care or even disqualify two athletes crossing the line together and finishing in for example 14th place jointly instead of 14th and 15th? My guess - no one cares. So change the rule!

text:
Step back and as yourself the validity and purpose of this "rule".  One must illustrate that they are sprinting across the finish line to the delight of the paid photographers so that the ITU can make money (which I support) on corporate sponsors; however, paying the pros next to nothing (which they should be embarrassed about - while the executive directors makes high six figures, look it up).


Drafting is cheating.  Littering is annoying - someone has to pick it up (unless Patrick went back and picked it up).  


Stupid and senseless rules that waste valuable time - as illustrated by all the "publicity" created by this absurd DQ.  Yes, this is a rule that has been a game changer for sure.  


I would love to sit in a room and listen to these idiots come up with the rule book.  Clearly the rule makers have never competed professionally and if they did, they spent to much time in the sun sucking on energy bars and gels.   And we wonder why Gwen left the sport....
author: @CoachRobbBeams

text:
Sorry, people do care. This wasn't your 5 year olds soccer tournament. This was pro triathlon. Ever seen a pro football game or pro baseball game with the teams going "let's just tie!".
Triathlon has enough of a challenge attracting sponsors and fans/audience .... so ..... let's just have all the triathlon races end in holding hands and singing Kumbaya. See how that attracts people interested in seeing competition. Triathlon can then move on to achieving world peace. Knucking Futs.

text: I had friends race in the London Olympics in Sprint Kayak. They were sprint specialists (in the 200m event, which lasts about 30 seconds), but they also had to race in the 1000m event (which lasts about 3 minutes). They were warned that they had to race the 1000 as hard as they can, even though it took place before the 200, or be disqualified from the Olympics altogether. Similar rules are in place in other sports.

Savage Poet to measure the force that is pressing on the pedals...not effort. Lets say you (normaly) Sprint at 1200 Watts for 5 secounds and in a race you give it all you have but you only manage 800 Watts ... did you go full effort or not?
Effort can not be measured in power numbers alone

Literally!

The best thing that you can do,
Keep a healthy lifestyle,
Whenever you are out, wear mask,
And avoid too crowded places of you can.


That's it.

text:
@@BumernTreLL There's no one-size-fits-all solution. Texas' population density is merely 114/sq miles, whereas Tokyo's is a whopping 16,480/sq miles. That makes quite a difference in a situation involving a highly contagious disease.

Also Japan has the highest percentage of elderly population in the world. I think the US only ranks 16th or something (I'm not sure exactly). But nowhere near Japan. This is the age group most vulnerable to the virus. Perhaps the Japanese' concerns regarding their health and safety stem from these factors (amongst others).
author: @bleakarro

text: @@bleakarro LOL what a bad comparison. Texas also have big cities with large population density
author: @BumernTreLL

text:
@@BumernTreLL The population density of the 2 major cities in Japan and Texas:

Houston’s population density is 3622/sq mile and Dallas 3,965/sq mile.

Tokyo’s 16,121/sq mile and Osaka’s 13,700/sq mile.
author: @bleakarro

text:
​@@bleakarro 
Tokyo: 6,363/km2
Houston: 1,398/km2

Both results are not small, but after crossing a certain amount of population, local conditions are not changing too much. You forget that Tokyo is full of multi level buildings- which does not mean that people have more contact with each other.

In addition, all the restrictions in the world and lockdowns have led to more deaths from diseases other than the virus itself. Plus, the mere restriction of freedom and the liquidation of public events in fear of what we already know, is totalitarianism, a form of corpo-communism.

So, to respond to your opinion from the first post: "blood is on the hands" of politicians, who in fear of the unknown and bribes from medical corporations, sentenced millions of people to: imprisonment, mental problems, suicide, dying without access to a doctors (because for example with the virus operations can;t be happened), weaker education, acidification of the body by the constant wearing of masks, segregating people into "vaccinated" and "not" and restricting their freedom like the Nazis, destruction of the medium and lower class of businesses in order to convict them to work in corporations (which will survive the crisis and are associated with the government).

And you put your hand to it, instead of thinking for yourself, you are calling for further restrictions.

text: Our Olympic athletes are not - as the media portrays them - the victims of society who have struggled against great adversity in order to gain success.  Team GB are certainly not 'Team Victim'.  These athletes are simply the nation's pampered minority. They literally have the world at their feet.  Of  course, with success comes celebrity and the opportunity to generate great personal wealth. 2018 when Pyenogchang Olympics was held in Korea, 
IOC asked Korean government to remove Dok-do Island on the map in the flag that Korean team used as Japan strongly insisted that the Olympics should not be involved in political issues.
So Korean team accepted the IOC's request to avoid the conflict.
2020 for Tokyo Olympics, Japanese government just mentioned Dok-do Island as their territory and posted it on their website.
Korean government raised the complaint and asked IOC to be involved in this issue, and IOC said NO.

Sick of this duplicity or corruption

text:
After World War II, Germany no longer use the Nazi flags used during the war, only has used their own German flags. 
The reason is that there is Germany's consideration and care that prevents the people of Germany's neighbor countries from recalling their memories of past Germany's invasion and historical suffering. But Japan still uses The rising sun flag despite Japan has the Japanese flag. This is a behavior with no consideration for neighboring countries that Japan has invaded in the past.
This is evidence that Japan has no reflection, regret or apology for World War II. Japan has said that it has healed the wounds by Japanese money and Japan has announced they apologized very much, It is very unreasonable to say that Japan has apologized and be proud of the flag used to invade other countries.
need to learn from Germany

If one of your neighbors invades your house and built roads, bridges and rail roads in order to steal your grains and assets, and also to use your house as a back yard for preparing to invade the next door bigger house... and pushed you not to use your language and to change you name by his naming rule, and made you as a slave,, when you shout out independence, he hit you and tortured you to die.   
building all of them was for him not for you to gain more benefits from you.  Do you think he was a great Donator of you without any reason but just love you? 
If you had this situation would you be pleased and feel thank him? Could you say he developed your house and you?
Non-sense,     Japanese government has hidden many historical facts to their people that would be shamed to them.

author: @nahojanen

text:
Don't try to cover it up with the different issue, please. The fact is that flag is obviously recognized as a symbol of colonialization by people who passed through colonialization area and if you understand this thing, there is no reason to use that flag anymore. It is up to people whether they despise the national flags of colonial nations or not. However, the red rising flag was used for invading countries and even it is not recognized as a Japan's national flag, though still they use their army flag. We are raising the issue that the flag has meaning of imperialism against peace and human rights in the past wartime and try to stop use that flag. So, does Germany use Nazi flag globally? They use their national flag.


I am asking you in another way then, what is the reason to pursue this controversial flag from Japanese side?
author: @yujeongha3074

text:
@@yujeongha3074 Your talk only shows a Korean view, parochial, largely limited in a specific cultural context. The view or prejudice can never be shared by vast majority others around the world. Besides the issue is highly politicized, against the Olympics principle. The IOC never backs down. 

>>>>what is the reason to pursue this controversial flag from Japanese side?

There is no Japan side. Rising Sun is one of very popular, common and free designs. It is NOT owned solely by Japan. Its use in public spaces is widely, globally acceptable. Korea's claim infringes free speech. Worse, some psycho Koreans criticize almost everything "looking like a rising sun." It is totally out of context. It's not merely Japanese but many others who accuse Korean oppressive behavior and excessive self-victimization with regard to this particular design. 

If you are to stay logical and consistent, do question other national/military flags which represent colonialism or militarism. Otherwise nobody would take your point. They only see it as another Korean nitpick and hypocrisy.
author: @nahojanen

text:
​@@nahojanen Let me controvert your point of view. First of all, I am an Korean and that's why my point of view is in Korean side, of course. Then I would say you are quite delivering your points that the Japanese goverment stick to. Isn't it obvious? What's the point you mention this thing? lol 


We are raising our voice and telling people "what you've been using has a really bad meaning for Asian people and please stop using it." And hey, many Koreans has been doing social activities regarding this so far so you can't say it is prejudice and dimish people's voice to flight the right. And this is the longstanding issue between Korea and Japan, if I would say just focus on the history of my country.


Also, I didn't say IOC should take it back or something, just share what my thought here.


You didn't get the point of this historical issue as well. Alright, like you said, I understand that design is used regardless of the historical meaning around the world. As I said, IT DOESN'T MATTER!  We are telling people what that symbol means to Asian people. BTW, I've never seen this symbol is consumed popularly in abroad as I've been traveling and living in abroad in many years so far lol. Whether it is perceived globally or something is just based on your hypothesis. I know that some brands were criticized to use it, but it doesn't mean that it is so popular.


We were victims in the wartime. What we are saying to correct the wrong is not self-victimization, but letting people know in the world what happened to us and how important it is to say, as a victim!


I've already given you the answer. So does Germany allow to use Nazi symbol in public? No. I am not experts about this so I don't know which countries use their flags and what meaning they have. And this is another topic as well. I am not universally interested in this kind of topic because I don't know all of those histories! However, if people say something has bad meaning, I would stop using it. It is just common sense.


Also, I never say any words that downgrade your points or use insulting languages. However, judging by your comments, your intention is not logically delivering your points but unnecessarily insulting Korean people's fight for rights.


Does your point is that the design is free of historical background, OR many countries still use their flags having colonialization? I say, YES it has historical background that Japan used its flag when they trampled Asian countries. They exploited people and violated human rights, which were unacceptable in modern society. That symbol reminds Asian pacific countries of imperialism that Nazi symbol does of Jews. If you want to use it, use it. However, we keep raising our voice and telling people the historical truth and meaning. Whether you do it or not, it is your decision.

text: At present, a large amount of rice is still produced in the Fukushima region, which is heavily radioactive in Japan. But the rice can never be sold to Japanese consumers. Radioactively contaminated rice produced in Fukushima is sold at very low prices for making simple food for restaurants and convenience stores in tourist spots in Japan. It is secretly supplied in large quantities through hotels and restaurants throughout Japan, as well as restaurants that are frequently visited by tourists. Perhaps the food you eat at a tourist restaurant in Japan is likely to be radiation-contaminated rice produced in Fukushima. You won't believe it, but this is obvious.

text: Anyone who wants to visit Japan must know that there is a possibility of being exposed to radiation.  The Japanese government claims that the Fukushima nuclear power plant situation that was caused as a result of the 2011 East Japan Earthquake was resolved, but this is false news.  Like the Chernobyl nuclear accident, radioactive pollution does not go away over hundreds of years.  In addition, they are trying to hold the Olympic Games in the area where the incident took place.  The Japanese government should immediately stop lying and disclose what is happening in the area.

At present, a large amount of rice is still produced in the Fukushima region, which is heavily radioactive in Japan. But the rice can never be sold to Japanese consumers. Radioactively contaminated rice produced in Fukushima is sold at very low prices for making simple food for restaurants and convenience stores in tourist spots in Japan. It is secretly supplied in large quantities through hotels and restaurants throughout Japan, as well as restaurants that are frequently visited by tourists. Perhaps the food you eat at a tourist restaurant in Japan is likely to be radiation-contaminated rice produced in Fukushima. You won't believe it, but this is obvious.

text:
If you are planning a trip to Japan, I would recommend you to search for "Fukushima rice" on Youtube right away and decide.
Many Japanese foods made with rice contaminated with radioactivity produced in Fukushima will seriously harm your health and curse your descendants.
Currently, a large amount of rice is Currently, a large amount of rice is produced every year in Fukushima, Japan's radiation-exposed area, but it can never be sold to Japanese consumers. After purchasing a large amount of rice from the Japanese government, the rice from Fukushima was secretly supplied in large quantities through hotels, restaurants, and many catering establishments that are frequented by tourists, and is now being consumed by tourists. Perhaps it is very likely that the rice you bought at a tourist resort restaurant in Japan was contaminated with radioactivity produced in Fukushima.
The Japanese government has officially produced in Fukushima.
The Japanese government has officially announced that it will provide food to athletes from various countries participating in the Tokyo Olympic Games in 2020 by making agricultural products and various kinds of food products produced in Fukushima where the nuclear power plant exploded. The Japanese government is in the position to announce to the world that agricultural products, livestock products and seafood produced in Fukushima are safe from misunderstandings of contamination of radioactivity.

text:
Hello everyone. 
I live in Tochigi, next to Fukushima.
And it's population is around 2 million.
So far, every one of us have never felt the effects of radioactivity.
So we keep living here.
Also, 14 million people live in Tokyo because Tokyo is safe!
Many people (I think most of them is Korean) here seem to compain about radioactivity in Tokyo, but, what do you know about safety in Tokyo? Are you in Tokyo?
If Tokyo were really unsafe because of radioactivity, why are so many people living here and staying healthy?
If you are not in Tokyo and complain about radioactivity, you are ignorant.
I can't understand why so many people recommend other people not to go Tokyo even though many people are living thare healthily. 
And some people here said that Japanese media were lying, but, how did you know that? Is your information really correct? 
Tokyo was chosen to be host for Olympic Games because experts knew that Tokyo was safe!
Many foreigner have already visited Tokyo to see Rugby World Cup so you don't need to worry about it.

To Korean
Pyeongchang was so great!
Then, why do you want to bother next Olympic?
Tokyo is close to your country, so you can enjoy Tokyo Olympic easily as well as Pyeongchang.
I think it's great!
I konw how much you hate Abe, but Olympic is celebration of peace and politics doesn't matter.
If you think that Tokyo is really unsafe and afraid about it, it's okay.
But please stop bothering next Olympic just because you hate Japan.

I love South Korea, 한국.
we shouldn't be at the mercy of politics.

author: @caperider1160

text:
Can the legacy of the 1964 Olympics be repeated in 2020? That was a different era and in a different time. I don't believe it will have the same transformative effect as it did then. This is really the Prime Minister's games. 

To show that Japan has fully recovered from the 2011 tsunami disaster. But really if that was the case. There would have been more effort put into those hardest stricken areas. 

But at the same time I still believe in the Olympic movement. I may not always agree with it's politics. But I also believe that a world without it would be a much worse place to be. 

We already have enough hatred, misunderstanding, discrimination and frankly indifference in the world as it is. The games is one of the few rare opportunities that we stop killing each other. 

For 2 weeks in the spirit of competition in sport. Anyone else has a better idea how we can do that in a way. Which can bring the world together for a short time then be my guest. Otherwise quit the stupid protests and support your athletes!!

text: The  Rising Sun Flag is the military flag of Japan. It was used as the war flag of  the Imperial Japanese Army and the ensign of the Imperial Japanese Navy until  the end of World War II. The flag was heavily used by the Japanese in the  conquest and the occupation of East Asia, it is seen as offensive in countries  which were victims of Japanese colonialism, largely because of the war crimes  perpetrated by the Japanese military. This flag has similar meaning with Nazi  flag. You should ban this flag in all Olympic games.

author: @lukfehr3112

text: To emphasize the safety of Fukushima, Japan has raised the radiation exposure limit from 1 mSv (milli-sievert: unit of radioactivity) to 20 mSv. Rather than resolving the problem of radioactive contamination, it seems to be trying to raise awareness that it is lower than the exposure limit by changing standards. Japan currently has virtually no disposal of Fukushima nuclear waste. 97% of the accidentally melted nuclear fuel is still stored inside the nuclear power plant, where radioactive contaminated water is exponentially flowing daily as groundwater seeps into it. Recently, the international environmental group Greenpeace pointed out that Japan plans to keep it in the Pacific. Australian nuclear expert Helen Keldicott said, "The Japanese government wants to reassure them that the radiation levels are low, but it's all a lie."

text:
Fukushima 2020 Olympics Nightmare: Is Abe Criminally Insane?
This 2019 documentary looks at the plans of Japan Prime Minister Shinzo Abe to bring the Olympic baseball games and Paralympics to Fukushima during the 2020 July August Japan Olympic games. It interviews experts, community activists and trade unionists about the reality of Fukushima and the massive propaganda campaign to cover-up the continuing dangers and crisis.
PM Abe told the International Olympics Committee that Fukushima had been "decontaminated" but there is over 1 million tons of tritium radiocative water in tanks surrounding the broken nuclear reactors, the melted nuclear rods still remain in the reactors and there are tens of thousands of bags of contaminated radioactive material spread throughout the prefecture. The Abe government and it's IOC representatives have also been involved in corruption through bribery of IOC delegates to vote for having the Olympics in Japan.
This documentary hears from people in Japan about the reality of having the 2020 Olympics in Japan and Fukushima.
Additional media:

author: @miniblue5921

text:
60 Minutes Australia
게시일: 2018. 4. 11.
When a tsunami triggered the explosion at the Fukushima nuclear plant in 2011, the world feared the worst and for good reason. It is the most devastating nuclear disaster since Chernobyl. Tens of thousands of people were forced to leave their homes and millions of others now live in fear of serious illness. Radiation is everywhere - in the soil, trees, food, air and water. The Japanese are trying to clean it up, but they're fighting a losing battle. This Sunday, Liz Hayes goes inside the exclusion zone to the ghost cities, deserted and abandoned, never to be lived in again. And 60 Minutes will also broadcast a warning from one of Australia's leading medical and nuclear experts, who says the 2020 Tokyo Olympics should be cancelled, due to radiation contamination.

(Another option is co-hosting, where the activities are split among 2-3 countries. Ex. author: @fajargintings5976

text:
Do you realize that for building up venues that numerous and able to withstand several thousands of spectators, including the medias, and not to mention the transports withing each of the venues, the hotels, the airports, etc... you are going to have to spend at least a hundred billion dollars just for having everything on schedule! Ask Rio or Pyeongchang how they feel once the olympics are over and that all the venues they've invested by putting themselves into debts for several decades are deserted and nobody uses them any longer!
Even in very powerful or super rich country they're still paying for 16 days of olympics that ended several years ago: in Beijing or London, they had to rise the local tax to make sure they could refund their investors, and they haven't finished yet.
Here in France, they are about to rise the taxes of every frenchmen for Paris 2024n while they said to the CIO that they only needed 6 billions to build the olympic village and an olympic swiming centre: eventually it turned out to be a lie: both of these infrastructures actually cost more than they said, many other existing venues are actually obsolete or too old and needs to be rebuilt or renovated, and several transports thay had planned to link the airports with the venues sites are not even sure to find their investors (And of course thay told the IOC that everything would be on schedule at the right time).
The Olympics are just about throwing billions and billions in an empty basket.
I love the Olympics, it's the greatest world sport competition that has ever been, but to be honest, only super rich country that can throw money away without counting can really afford them (such as the Emiratis for instance) or in my opinion, they should choose one unique city in the world to always host the competition every 4 years: the infrastructures would always be in place, meaning not needing to throw away billions and billions away to build every 4 years in a different city huge venues that will end up abandonned right after the games. In my opinion it should be Athens, since they're the original founders of the Olympics, but that remains a debatable subject.
I wish you good luck anyway if you really want to see the games in Indonesia by 12 years from now!
author: @MoreAwsomeMetal

text: @@MoreAwsomeMetal jakarta alredy have many great venue from asian games 2018
author: @starfromakihabara4896

text: @@starfromakihabara4896 Yes I didn't realize they hosted this event two years ago. But they still will lack some couple of venues (Open Water swiming, Athletic stadium and road events, BMX freestyle court...) and will the venues have the public capacity required to host spectators from the entire world ? If the answer is no to some existing venues, then this means a lot of work and a lot of money are going to be spent to make things bigger for the crowd and the media. Not to mention the Olympic village and the media village who cost a lot too, and all the transports line required to fluidly get thousands of people from their hotels to the venues, to the shopping and restaurants, then to another venue, then to the airport. The olympic games are insanely huge, and it's no mystery why when asked by referendum, the population of the candidate cities generaly say no to the olympics (this is what happened to Rome for 2024 or Salzburg for 2026).

text: South Korea did not object to Japan's adoption of the Rising Sun Flag for the Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force in 1952, nor to the entry into South Korean ports Japanese warships flying the flag on a warship at the 1998 and 2008 navy fleet review held in South Korea.[29] Negative South Korean campaigning against the Rising Sun Flag began in 2011 when a South Korean footballer Ki Sung-yueng was accused of making a racist gesture, which he defended claiming he was annoyed at having seen a Rising Sun Flag in the stadium.[30] In 2012, South Koreans who disapproved of the flag began to refer to it as a "war crime flag".[31][32] An analysis indicates that South Korean reactions to the Rising Sun Flag stem from a complicated mixture of emotional, excessive nationalism, and a nationalistic complex towards Japan.[33]

It is the design that the samurai has used as a family crest since the end of the Heian period in Japan. (900 years ago from now on.)
Hiashi-Mon(Sun‘s foot Crest) is a design of the solar beam or sunlight. The shape of the sun is round, easy to write as a mark, and easy to identify. In addition, the sun was the source of all things' growth, and it was a sacred thing to beat up the night. Since the end of the Heian era, the samurai have preferred to use the "red fan who sunrised the gold“. It doesn't change even in the sengoku era. The warlords longed for the sacred power of the sun and the greatness of the sun shining on the earth. In the Sengoku period, many of the flag-pointing objects depicted the Japanese flag in vermilion, and its sharpness and cheerfulness attracted the popularity of the warriors.
In Kitakyushu, the Clan of samurai were used by the Hiashi-mon( Sun‘s foot Crest )
The Hiashi-mon was used by the Kusano clan in Chikugo, the Ryuzoji clan in Hizen, Omura clan, and Kikuchi clan of Higo.Hiashi-mon( Sun‘s foot Crest ) is same as Sun riseing Flag
author: @両角-k4q

text:
“There has to be something wrong with you,” 

I understand this is a play on words. But it hurts me a little. I’m not going to lie about that. Paired with some of the other phrases you’ve used to advertise these games, I mean. C’mon. Do you really think these phrases (specifically the phrases I’d like to clarify, not the games itself of course) are going to encourage positive behaviour towards people with disabilities?

author: @izzyV1120

text:
Every disabled athlete I’ve spoken to thinks the ad is amazing. 

The wordplay of “something wrong with you” is witty, clever and generally on point - it juxtaposes the medical model positioning of impairment as meaning there is something ‘wrong with’ someone against the reality of the dedication, stoicism blurring into outright masochism and general rearranging of priorities seen in elite athletes, disabled and not. The smashing of the word ‘super’ hit home in a particularly delightful way. The whole ad is a very firm rejection of the othering of disabled people in favour of highlighting the extraordinary differences in the approach and attitude of all elite sportspeople - the entire point is that impairment is pretty much irrelevant. And indeed that steps, rather than wheelchairs, are the problem, ultimately.
author: @BocciaRaf

text: They are not super humans. In the ad a ball smashes the word “super”, leaving it to read “humans” to show we need to stop thinking of them as super humans, we need to stop thinking of them as inspirational. Disabled people have to battle against the obstacles put in their way by abled people. Branding them as “super humans” is in poor taste
author: @cking5530

text: @@cking5530 disagree, all athletes who reach the olympics/paralympics are pretty inspirational to me. They may not be to you, but they are to me :)
author: @raidwipe

text:
@@cking5530 they're super human to me and inspirational.

I've had Covid and been left with crutches and calipers... Because I couldn't walk at all at first. It severely affected my spine. 

Every single time this comes on during the day? I'm inspired, even if it's just taking my bins out or doing my own shopping because you've no idea how hard it is for some people.

But we fight and live life to our best
👍😉

So be grateful for your active physical life because it could change in a heartbeat.
💜
author: @toejamontoast

text: @C King has a point. After the 2012 Olympics in London when Paralympians were first branded as "super" human, disabled people, of which I am one, got a LOT of abuse be it straightforward or underhanded. The thinking was that "if Paralympians could do it, than why do you need extra help mate?" I had taxis refuse to stop for me, many doors I was unable to open because of spinal issues, constant questioning of my disability even though I could barely breathe as well. I LOVE the fact that they smashed the "SUPER" part. After all, no one was calling Olympians "super" human. All of them are humans at the top of their skills.
author: @titanium_di2402

text: If we generally think peak athleates who go on such exraordinary lengths then olympians and paralympians are superhuman . Not because they are disabled they are not angels sent from the heaven or every shit i hear . We all are humans with diferrences and they should be helped as non disabled people have needs and they are helped  Like with  airplanes instead of your own wings or cars ...
author: @perseasassimak6314

text: This is great! I love seeing Boccia here too, because the disabled people at my school used to do it for PE. My friends had disabilities including blindness and cerebral palsy as well as things like autism but it was something all of us could do that was accessible! We just needed someone to clap or have a ball with a bell or something in it for the blind girl! We even went to a local competition with other schools!

author: @2BeDoctor

text:
I disagree, the 2012 advert from Channel 4 “meet the superhumans” was focused on more traditional inspirational messaging, but the 2021 message has developed and now talks about the struggles of dealing with pressure, juggling real life and training, and the impact of Covid on athletes’ preparations. These are athletes who happen to be disabled rather than putting disability front and centre.



I think the double-meaning strapline is clever, to put yourself through all that effort for these games is monumental, any athlete at that level must be at least a little crazy.


And Channel 4 don’t just focus on marketing, 70% of their presenting team for the 2021 Games have disabilities and their investment in talent has made household names of people like Alex Brooker
author: @tomhaslam248

text: Completely agree Sabrina,i am surprised that no one has made this point before. I read it in the same way, i cant believe that way of frasing was approved.Using the word Wrong when refering to people with a disabily is not right.

text: The paralympics as a whole really needs to have more people who actually understand disabilities and accommodations as staff. It’s glaringly obvious how little everyone involved with this (besides the competitors) understand or care about disabilities and it’s making many people question the true intention behind even running this. First the whole incredibly hypocritical situation with Becca Myers, now this video not even having accurate  captioning which is one of the most basic and needed possible accommodations for disabled individuals.
author: @blache24

text: Hi, if you look in the caption they've posted two links to the audio descriptive and subtitled versions. Just wanted to let you know they're there because I agree with you, these things shouldn't be ignored and are extremely important. I know its not much in the grand scheme of things, but hopefully this makes you feel a bit better about this particular video. Hope you're having a nice day 😊

text:
Knuckles: Are you sure this is going to work boss? 
Sam: Of course it’s going to work. It looks like a Splurge Gun doesn’t it? 
Knuckles: Sort of, boss. 
Sam: Nonsense! Anything Dandy Dan can do, I can do better. You know that. Alright Knuckles, are you ready? 
Knuckles: Ready. (Cracks knuckles) 
Sam: DON’T DO THAT! 
Knuckles: Sorry boss. 
Sam: Alright take aim. 
(Knuckles starts up the gun) 
Sam: Ready. Set. FIRE! 
(The gun backfires and kills Knuckles) 
Sam: MISSED! It’s back to the drawing board Knuckles. Knuckles? 
(Sam sees the dead body) 
Sam: KNUCKLES SPEAK TO ME! (Starts ranting in Italian) THIS IS ALL YOUR FAULT! DO YOU HEAR ME? IT’S ALL YOUR FAULT! (Knocks down a cardboard cutout of Dandy Dan)

text: Being at the game and the energy was amazing!! text:
The  Tokyo  2020  Olympics    successfully  held  under  the   shadow  of  once  in  a  century  global  pandemic  drew   to  a  close  on  Sunday  8  August  2021.  
                      The  Tokyo  2020  Olympic    successfully  held  under  the   shadow  of  once  in  a  century  global  pandemic  drew   to  a  close  on  Sunday,  8  August  2021.  These  were  reported  to  have  been  held  amid  extraordinary  restrictions  and  mostly  behind  closed  doors,  with  athletic  feats  performed  for  a  world  still  struggling  against  the  coronavirus.   The  world  was  able  to  watch  the  competitive  feats  of  athletes  in  TV   Channels  or  online.  Credit  goes  to  Japanese  government  and  management  committee  to  bring  it  to  great  conclusion  without  reports  of  pressure  whether  it  was  possible  to  accomplish  during  worrisome  concerns  of   pandemic.    
                     In  this  context,  it  may  be  apt  to  refer  readers  to  this  Vedic  astrology  writer’s   related   prediction  in  article shared  widely  with  Japanese  news  media  last  year  on  16  September,  which  reads  as  follows:-
                      “( 6 ).  A  further  period  of  one  and  a  half    months  covering  second  half  of   July  and  August  in  2021   look  to  be  stepping  up  endeavors  towards  economic  sector  growth.  Some  positive  things  can  come    up  in  relation  to  health  ,  particularly  Covid-19.  Some  ambitious    or  strength-giving  program  can  take  place  with  some  success”.
                    Yes,  the  ambitious   program  took  place  in  Tokyo  from  23  July  to  8  August  in  2021.  It  can  be  perceived  that  successful  conclusion  of  Olympics  must  have  given  strength  to  Japanese  people.  Yes,  news  reported  some  spike  in  positive  cases  of  coronavirus  in  Japan  during  the  period.  
                     It  seems  the  prediction  may  have  served  the  purpose.
Kushal  kumar,
Sector 20-Panchkula.

text:
Funny thing about that:
That’s kind of the POINT of the Olympics. 

The Olympic Games include people kicking the competitive 💩 out of each other, sure. But the point is interaction and exchange, camaraderie and diplomacy. 

I like when people explore these personality traits but I don’t love it when they go the extra mile and exalt them. Not all of them anyway.

text: Kobe was great to me personally. After I airballed a series of free throws then caught fire. He explained his new tattoos. Psalms. author: @nealoliverryan

text: Thank you Kobe for teaching me language. The Hebrew 22, the Greek and the carry over in other languages. Beyond dedication to all things including his faith. He was at church on his final morning. And he was actively doing what the message asked in his final moments. Thanks for the all-star autographed jersey Kobe. Thanks for making my Dad so proud. Thanks for allowing us to shoot on the pre-season game you forced into OT then won. Thanks for the invite to the Olympic game where you beat the banana boat squad hitting the game winner in July 2007 in Vegas. Beyond treasured memories.

text: Sounds like Kobe might have had a form of Asperger's and didn't know it. I recently was diagnosed myself. And I used to think I was a horrible person for not liking people or wanting to be around them. So I found reasons not to like them in order to justify the way I was feeling in public. It's difficult when whatever you're thinking is what flies out of your mouth with very little emotion. It's very difficult for us to put ourselves in the shoes of others, nearly impossible. We can't read facial expressions or take hints from people - even if we know them for years. We usually have a poker face on, emotionless - and something like Barnes throwing a ball in our face would get zero reaction from us. It sounds like Kobe would have scored very high in masking - just like me - which is why people never noticed. BUT always did notice there was something different about me. Like Kobe. I can't relate at ALL to that level of success but I can relate to certain things. People like that become successful and we mask even harder in order to cope. And we only get honest about ourselves with people we really trust. If we aren't around those people - we are going to be "fidgety and antsy". And you hyper-focus on whatever it is you love to the detriment of everything else in your life. To the point where all we care about is mastering every facet of our interest - whatever it may be. Now if you add an unbelievable amount of fame to that and I do not know what the result would be mentally. Perhaps that's why his guard was always up and why he looked uncomfortable so many times in public in the middle of huge crowds. And sometimes the mask would take over and he was charming as hell. But over time his public mask was larger than life by retirement time and he probably couldn't even have told you who the "real" Kobe was.. He was a very special but also very strange individual. I believe we didn't get to see the real Kobe as a person, until he was retired. Sleep in peace brother - you and Gigi and the rest of the people who died on that damned 'copter.

text: 2008 is probably the greatest Olympics ever, closely followed by 2012, but in 2012 sport as a whole peaked: not only the incredible Olympics which were dominated by the all-time greats Bolt and Phelps, but you had also the peak of Messi-Ronaldo rivalry, Messi scoring 91 goals in a calendar year, the crazy Manchester City title run in England, Chelsea incredible run in the UCL, Spain golden generation winning another Euro, Zlatan bicycle kick goal,  it was the peak year for Nadal-Djokovic rivalry (the AO final is legendary), Federer won another Wimbledon, Murray with the Olympic gold, Lomachenko and Usyk won gold too, Klitschko brothers together dominated boxing for one last year, etc.

text: For those unfamiliar with figure skating yes these guys are incredible, but the finer details make it even more worthy. Noticed that he catches her above the level of his own head, that she finished the rotation well before he actually catches her and that she doesn’t use her arms at all to support him in coming down. Most other couples catch quite a bit lower and they need both partners hands, grasping to stabilize the catch

text: Алёна Савченко - легендарная украинская фигуристка, многократная чемпионка Европы и мира и олимпийская медалистка, которая не отказалась от своей олимпийской мечты даже после того, как ее партнер завершил карьеру, нашла нового молодого партнера и с ним завоевала золото на олимпиаде и чемпионате мира.
